name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: This lecture is about the methods for text categorization.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So in this lecture we're going to discuss how to do text for categorization.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _First
column6: there're many methods for text categorization. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: In such a method the idea is to determine the category

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: based on some rules that we design carefully

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: to reflect the domain knowledge about the category prediction problem.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So for example
column6: if you want to do topic categorization for news articles you _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _can say well
column6: if the news article mentions word like a game and sports three times. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: That we're going to say it's about sports things like that and this would allow us

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: to deterministically decide which category a document that should be put into.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: Now such a strategy would work well if the following conditions hold.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: First the categories must be very well defined and this allows the person to

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: clearly decide the category based on some clear rules.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: A certainly the categories as

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: half to be easy to distinguished at the based on a surface features in text.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So that means some official features like keywords or

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _punctuations or whatever
column6: you can easily identify in text to data. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _For example
column6: if there is some special vocabulary that is known _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: to only occur in a particular category.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And that would be most effective because we can easily use such a vocabulary or

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: padding of such a vocabulary to recognize this category.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: Now we also should have sufficient knowledge for

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _designing these words
column6: and so if that's the case then such a can be effective. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And so it does have a in some domains and sometimes.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _However
column6: in general
column7: there are several problems with this approach. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _First off
column6: because it's label intensive it requires a lot of manual work. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _Obviously
column6: we can't do this for all kinds of categorization problems. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: We have to do it from scratch for a different problem.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _problem because given the rules
column6: what they need. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So it doesn't scale up well.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _Secondly
column6: it cannot handle uncertainty in rules

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: often the rules Aren't 100% reliable.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: Take for example looking at occurrences of words in texts and

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: trying to decide the topic.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: It's actually very hard to have 100% correct rule.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So for example you can say well
column6: if it has game

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: basketball Then for sure it's about sports.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _But one can also imagine some types of articles that mention these cures
column6: but _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: may not be exactly about sports or only marginally touching sports.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _The main topic could be another topic
column6: a different topic than sports. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So that's one disadvantage of this approach.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _And then finally
column6: the rules maybe inconsistent and _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: this would lead to robustness.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _More specifically
column6: and sometimes
column7: the results of categorization may be different _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: that depending on which rule to be applied.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So as in that case that you are facing uncertainty.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _And you will also have to decide an order of applying the rules

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: or combination of results that are contradictory.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So all these are problems with this approach.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And it turns out that both problems can be solved or

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: alleviated by using machine learning.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So these machine learning methods are more automatic.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _But
column6: I still put automatic in quotation marks because _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: they are not really completely automatic cause it still require many work.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: More specifically we have to use a human experts to help in two ways.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: First the human experts must annotate data cells was category labels.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And would tell the computer which documents should receive which categories.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And this is called training data.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _And then secondly
column6: the human experts also need to provide a set of features to _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: represent each text object.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: That can potentially provide a clue about the category.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So
column6: we need to provide some basic features for the computers to look into. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: In the case of tax a natural choice would be the words.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So
column6: using each has a feature is a very common choice to start with

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: but of course there are other sophisticated features like phrases or

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: even parts of ancients tags or even syntax to the structures.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So once human experts can provide this then we can use machine running to learn

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: soft rules for categorization from the training data.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So
column6: soft rules just means

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _we're going to get decided which category we should be assigned for a document

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: but it's not going to be use using a rule that is deterministic.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So we might use something similar to saying that if it matches games

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _sports many times
column6: it's likely to be sports. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _But
column6: we're not going to say exactly for sure but instead

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: we're going to use probabilities or weights.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So that we can combine much more evidences.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So
column6: the learning process
column7: basically is going to figure out which _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: features are most useful for separating different categories.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And it's going to also figure out how to optimally combine features to minimize

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: errors of the categorization of the training data.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So the training data
column6: as you can see here

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: It's the basis for learning.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _And then
column6: the trained classifier can be applied to a new text object to predict _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: the most likely category.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And that's to simulate the prediction of what

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: human Would assign to this text object.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: If the human were to make a judgement.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So when we use machine learning for text categorization we can also

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: talk about the problem in the general setting of supervisement.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So the set up is to learn a classifier to map a value of X.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: Into a map of Y so here X is all the text objects and

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _Y is all the categories
column6: a set of categories. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So the class phi will take any value in x as input and

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: would generate a value in y as output.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: We hope that output y with this right category for x.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _And here correct
column6: of course
column7: is judged based on the training data. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So that's a general goal in machine learning problems or supervised learning

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: problems where you are given some examples of input and output for a function.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _And then the computer's going to figure out the

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: how the function behaves like based on this examples.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And then try to be able to compute the values for

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: future x's that when we have not seen.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So in general all methods would rely on discriminative

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: features of text objects to distinguish different categories.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So that's why these features are very important and

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: they have to be provided by humans.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And they will also combine multiple features in a weight map with weights

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: to be optimized to minimize errors on the training data.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So after the learning processes optimization problem.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: An objective function is often tied into the errors on the training data.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: Different methods tend to vary in their ways of measuring the errors on

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: the training data.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _They might optimize a different objective function

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: which is often also called a loss function or cost function.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: They also tend to vary in their ways of combining the features.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So a linear combination for example is simple
column6: is often used. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: But they are not as powerful as nonlinear combinations.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: But nonlinear models might be more complex for

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _training
column6: so there are tradeoffs as well. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: But that would lead to different variations of

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: many variations of these learning methods.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So in general we can distinguish two kinds of classifiers at a high level.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: One is called generative classifiers.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: The other is called discriminative classifiers.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: The generative classifiers try to learn what the data looks like in each category.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So it attempts to model the joint distribution of the data and

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: the label x and y and this can then be factored out to

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: a product of why the distribution of labels.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And the joint probability of sorry the conditional

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _probability of X given Y
column6: so it's Y. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So we first model the distribution of labels and

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: then we model how the data is generate a particular label here.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _And once we can estimate these models

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: then we can compute this conditional probability of label given data

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: based on the probability of data given label.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: And the label distribution here by using the Bayes Rule.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _Now this is the most important thing
column6: because this conditional probability _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: of the label can then be used directly to decide which label is most likely.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So in such approaches objective function is actually likelihood.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _And so
column6: we model how the data are generated. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So it only indirectly captures the training errors.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _But if we can model the data in each category accurately

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: then we can also classify accurately.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _One example is Naïve Bayes classifier
column6: in this case. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _The other kind of approaches are called discriminative classifies

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: and these classifies try to learn what features separate categories.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So they direct or attack the problem of categorization for separation of classes.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: So sorry for the problem.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So
column6: these discriminative classifiers attempt to model _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: the conditional probability of the label given the data point directly.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _So
column6: the objective function tends to directly measure the errors of _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: categorization on the training data.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _Some examples include a logistical regression

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: _support vector machines
column6: and k-nearest neighbors. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.8 Text Categorization- Methods (00-11-50).srt
text: We will cover some of these classifiers in detail in the next few lectures.
